aspects.current_activity: Practicing his stone-throwing skills with his son, demonstrating different techniques and seeing who can throw the farthest.
aspects.short_term_goal: To perfect a new throwing technique that involves a unique spin to increase distance.
aspects.long_term_goal: To raise his son to be the finest stone-thrower in the mountain range, capable of defending their territory from any human intruders.
aspects.personality: Has a rough sense of humor, often finding amusement in the folly of humans who wander too close to his training grounds.
aspects.fear_weakness: Terrified of losing his son, which causes him to hesitate in dangerous situations.
aspects.belief_value: Believes that strength and skill are paramount, and that humans are intruders to be dealt with swiftly.
aspects.relationship: He has a strong bond with his son, who is the only one he shows genuine affection towards.
aspects.potential_quest: Could ask the player to retrieve a forgotten toy for his son, which is lost near the edge of human settlements, warning them about the dangers of being spotted.

dialogue: Well, well! Another tiny one wandering into my training grounds?
You adventurers are like rocks in the river—easy to toss aside.
I hope you’re here for something important, or you might just become my next practice target.
My son can throw a stone further than you can run! Care for a wager?
Why do humans always come to the mountains? Can't you find a cozy inn somewhere?
Be gone before I mistake you for a training dummy!

actions.name: Rock Hurl
actions.description: Bergor hurls a large boulder at a target up to 60 feet away. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d10 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Bergor can only use this action if he has a boulder within reach.

loot: A selection of worn but sturdy giant-sized leather armor, a handmade stone carving of a mountain (worth a small sum), and a pouch containing a few gemstones (totaling 50 gold pieces) found within the training area.

description.summary: A hulking Giant Rogue who spends his days honing the art of stone-throwing in the mountains.
details: Towering above the treetops, his gnarled hands deftly grip boulders as if they were mere pebbles, showcasing his immense strength.
His skin is a patchwork of earthy tones, resembling the rugged cliffs around him, while a tangle of dark hair flows down his back, peppered with twigs and leaves.
The air around him crackles with tension each time he prepares to hurl a rock, accompanied by the ominous sound of shifting earth beneath his feet.
With a perpetual scowl etched into his rugged features, his deep voice rumbles like distant thunder whenever he chuckles at the sight of pitiful human adventurers.
He has a soft spot for his small son, whose laughter echoes among the mountains, providing a stark contrast to the menace he poses to any intruding humans.
